solution_line_template: The number of students who scored 100% is {fraction_100_percent}*{total_students} = <<{fraction_100_percent}*{total_students}={students_100_percent}>>{students_100_percent}
Out of the {total_students} students, {total_students}-{students_100_percent} = <<{total_students}-{students_100_percent}={students_not_100_percent}>>{students_not_100_percent} did not score 100%.

If {percentage_over_80} of the students who did not score 100% managed to score over 80%, then {percentage_over_80}*{students_not_100_percent} =<<{percentage_over_80}*{students_not_100_percent}={students_over_80_percent}>>{students_over_80_percent} students scored over 80%
The number of students who failed is {students_not_100_percent}-{students_over_80_percent} = <<{students_not_100_percent}-{students_over_80_percent}={failed_students}>>{failed_students}
